topic.title: RHEL Compute Node Installation on UEFI Node

section.title: Introduction

sectiondiv.p:
required a manual procedure if you wanted to use the lifecycle manager to install RHEL 7.2 on UEFI nodes as described in the article
here.
This procedure has been automated in the lifecycle manager.

section.p: Before you attempt to use the lifecycle manager to install RHEL on UEFI nodes, you should install any hLinux nodes or any RHEL on legacy BIOS nodes first.

Execute the following steps to re-image one or more nodes after you have run the ready-deployment.yml playbook:
Run the RHEL-specific playbooks:
cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook prepare-rhel-loader.yml ansible-playbook prepare-rhel-grub2.yml -e nodelist=node1[,node2,node3]
Re-image the node(s):
cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost bm-reimage.yml -e nodelist=node1[,node2,node3]
Run the cobbler-deploy playbook:
cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost cobbler-deploy.yml
You will need to backup the grub.cfg-* and grubx64.efi files in /srv/tftp/grub/ as they will be overwritten on cobbler deploy.
The procedure for Secure Boot is just the same. Simply enable secure boot as described in the New Features article.
